column4: anyone else willing to help me out since the guy that was helping me left? :/ im about to give up
have you attempted to fresh install 10.04?
yes, 9.04, 9.10, and 10.04. all give me the same problem
and since I'm late to the party.. what is the problem?
everything freezes and processes running stop (wifi, downloads, music, etc) after about 30 seconds of inactivity. moving the mouse or any other kind of user input makes it snap out
anything show up on dmesg?
i don't know what i'm looking for but theres nothing obvious sticking out to me
should be at the tail end of the file.. and if it's not looking like a sore thumb then probably doesn't show there.. Is this a home built machine, store bought, desktop or laptop?
store bought gateway laptop, ran 8.04 and 8.10 fine as well as vista
vista isn't a good comparison.. 8.04 & 8.10 are.. the question is what's changed enough to give the machine a headache..
could be a touchpad thing..  maybe ACPI... AH! do you have a separate /home directory?
not that i know of, everything on the install was default. clean format and install
so no separate home with old stuff lying around.. well.. that makes it more difficult.. what's the make and model of the gateway?
DOH!  what's the model of the gateway
it's a M-153xl
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DzQHzIjQaws

most likely it's related to the ATI card.. but I"m guessing.. there have been issues with ATI after a certain release because X.org was updated and the drivers ATI provided were for specific cards only.. Unfortunately I"m no ATI guy.. Nvidia here.. which has always worked well except on my machine with 10.04 ubuntu.. but fine with Kubuntu.. have you tried kubuntu?
I'd betchya a dollar to a donut that it's the ATI card doing it.
check the ati site and see what cards are supported by the latest driver for linux.. see if you card is listed..
then I think there's an ATI driver and one produced by someone else.. checkem' both out to see if they may work.. sorry.. that's about all I can offer.
the driver on their site says "Automated installer and Display Drivers for X.Org 6.7, 6.8, 6.9, 7.0, 7.1, 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, or 7.5"
yes.. but what cards does it support
the current versioin is 7.1 or above.. not sure which
good luck!
